meta.title: RMS – Production Robot Management System
meta.subtitle: Full-Stack Ownership • Live Production • Robotics & Automation
meta.shortDescription: A production-grade robot management system actively used by hotels to control autonomous service robots in real environments.

content.title: Overview
body: RMS (Robot Management System) is a production-grade, enterprise-level platform that I designed, built, and deployed as part of my work at the company.
The system is live in production and is actively used by 5+ hotels to manage their robotic fleets, handle robot calls, and automate real-world operational tasks.
RMS is a mission-critical system that directly controls physical robots operating in hospitality environments and supports 24/7 reliability.
This project is not a demo, prototype, or academic exercise — it is a real business system, used daily by real customers.

content.title: Project Purpose & Business Impact
body: The purpose of RMS is to provide hotels with a centralized, secure, and scalable control platform for managing service robots across multiple hotels and locations.

RMS enables dispatching robot calls and operational tasks in real time, automating robot actions based on live external data, monitoring robot state, availability, and execution, and enforcing strict security, permissions, and auditability.
RMS bridges the gap between software systems and physical robotics, enabling hotels to operate robots efficiently, safely, and at scale.

content.title: Real-World Production Usage
bullets: Controls live robots in real environments

sections.subtitle: Robot & Machine Management
items: Centralized management of robots and machines
Assignment of robots to hotels, locations, and zones

items: Deep production integration with Yunji Technology, a Chinese company specializing in autonomous hospitality robots
Secure communication with Yunji robot APIs
Dispatching robot commands and operational tasks

content.title: Vendor-Agnostic Design
body: The system is designed to be vendor-agnostic, allowing future robot providers to be integrated without rewriting business logic.

content.title: Automation & Web-Driven Task Pipelines
body: RMS includes a dedicated automation layer that enables robots to act based on live external information.

sections.subtitle: Automation Flow
items: Puppeteer-based web automation and scraping
Extraction of data from external web systems
Validation and normalization of scraped data
Conversion of data into structured robot tasks
Secure dispatch of tasks to robots via backend APIs
End-to-end pipeline: External Web Source → Automation (Puppeteer) → RMS Backend Processing → Robot Task Dispatch → Physical Robot Execution

sections.subtitle: Automation Outcome
items: Allows robots to perform dynamic, data-driven actions, not static or manual commands

content.title: Authentication, Authorization & Security
body: Security was a core design principle, not an afterthought.
Firebase Authentication is used as the identity provider, with ID tokens verified on every request.
Strict ownership-based authorization is enforced server-side.
Users can only access entities they own or are assigned to.
All permission checks are validated in the backend.
Role-aware access is enforced for admin, operator, and scoped users.
Rate limiting and request validation are applied.
The system includes protection against unauthorized access and privilege escalation.

content.title: Admin Dashboard & Operational UI
bullets: Soft deletion with full history preservation
body: The UI is optimized for clarity, speed, and operational efficiency, not just appearance.
